title: Figma Unveils 8 Essential Tips for Crafting Scalable Branded Templates in Buzz

paragraphs.content: Figma's official blog has released "8 Tips for Designers Building Branded Templates in Figma Buzz," focusing on responsive, modular designs that enable marketers to customize assets without breaking layouts.The guide emphasizes tools like auto layout as the backbone for consistent spacing in elements such as buttons and text boxes, even with expanding content like long headlines.It promotes separating text layers with descriptive names like "Event Title" or "CTA Button Text," including example formats such as “Date of Event (e.g. July 10, 2025)” to support Bulk Create from CSV/XLSX imports.

paragraphs.content: Component variants allow flexible swaps for logos in horizontal/vertical orientations or multi-color illustrations via the inline toolbar, reducing the need for separate templates.These practices integrate with Figma Buzz's brand controls, where designers lock elements like logos while leaving text and images editable for team use.The tips position Buzz as a shared space for building on-brand assets at scale, from social campaigns to digital ads.

sections.title: Mastering Auto Layout and Layer Separation for Responsive Templates

paragraphs.content: Designers should start with a new Figma Buzz file, using creation tools or pasting from Figma Design, and name text layers descriptively to clarify purposes for users.Auto layout ensures dynamic adjustments for varying content lengths, maintaining brand consistency across outputs.Testing assets with realistic content verifies accommodation for different text and image types before publishing.

paragraphs.content: Publishing involves entering a clear name, description with usage guidelines, and thumbnail, making templates available in the team's picker.Templates appear with pink outlines and lock icons, limiting edits to unlocked fields via the Edit content panel.Users can swap component variants or remove guidelines for full access if needed.

sections.title: Leveraging Component Variants and Design System Integration

paragraphs.content: Component sets from Figma Design paste directly into Buzz, connecting templates to design systems for managing variables like layouts, colors, and sizes.Marketers can select options for platforms like Instagram or LinkedIn, add logos or CTAs, or swap illustrations while staying on-brand.Flexible templates offer multiple layouts browsable and customizable within Buzz.

paragraphs.content: Brand controls act as guardrails, locking positions by default and specific layers to empower independent asset creation.Teams benefit from campaign-thinking templates covering related formats like Instagram posts and stories.Buzz's open beta supports Full, Dev, Content, and Starter plans, fostering momentum in brand asset production.
